meaningMnemonic: Any number with a つ attached to it means you are counting that number of things. In this case, it's <vocabulary>six things</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can guess that it uses the kun'yomi reading. Here's a mnemonic to help you do that:

What are the <vocabulary>six things</vocabulary> that you need to count? This time you are counting six cows. The reason it's six is because you wanted exactly six <reading>moo</reading>s (むっ). No more, no less. You're very particular about your moos.
